definition: Qiufen or Autumn Equinox, 16th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 23rd September-7th October
autumn/fall/harvest time
surname Qiu
old variant of 秋[qiu1]
see 鞦韆|秋千[qiu1 qian1]
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
the autumn equinox

sentences.english: Timing recently had a autumnal equinox, feel suddenly increased some cool idea.
sentences.chinese: 时序刚刚过了秋分，就觉得突然增加了一些凉意。

sentences.english: However, the Autumn Equinox is not a fixed day and there may or may not be a full moon on that day.
sentences.chinese: 然而，每年秋分的日子都不同，在秋分不一定有圆月。

sentences.english: However, the Autumn Equinox is not a fixed day and there may or may not be a full moon on that day.
sentences.chinese: 然而，每年秋分的日子都不同，在秋分不一定有圆月。

sentences.english: Though it went on year round, the height of cricket fighting was between the summer solstice and autumn equinox.
sentences.chinese: 虽然它了全年的高度板球战斗之间的夏至和秋分。

sentences.english: We call the equinoxes spring and fall.
sentences.chinese: 这两个分点，人们分别称之为春分和秋分。

sentences.english: The weather suddenly grew chilly just after the autumnal equinox.
sentences.chinese: 时序刚刚过了秋分，就觉得突然增加了一些凉意。

sentences.english: The Autumnal Equinox is the best time for wheat-sowing.
Explanation: Twice a year, at the Spring and Fall equinox, the Sun rises due east.
sentences.chinese: 一年两次，春分和秋分，太阳从正东方升起。

sentences.english: According to astronomy, the Mid Autumn Festival occurs at the autumn equinox.
sentences.chinese: 根据天文学，中秋节是秋分之时。

sentences.english: Twice a year, at the Spring and Fall equinox, the Sun rises due east.
sentences.chinese: 一年两次，春分和秋分，太阳从正东方升起。

sentences.english: But I thought there was a better chance of seeing them around the time of the equinoxes.
sentences.chinese: 可是我认为在春分和秋分前后看到的机会更多。

sentences.english: Mid-Autumn Day falls during the autumn equinox.
sentences.chinese: 中秋节来临时正好在“秋分”前后。

sentences.english: And you can't get any closer to the September equinox than this.
sentences.chinese: 而这一天也是距秋分日近的不能再近的一天。

definition: Chunfen or Spring Equinox, 4th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 21st March-4th April
Chushu or End of Heat, 14th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 23rd August-7th September
Liqiu or Start of Autumn, 13th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 7th-22nd August
Xiazhi or Summer Solstice, 10th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 21st June-6th July
Shuangjiang or Frost Descends, 18th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 23rd October-6th November
Hanlu or Cold Dew, 17th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 8th-22nd October
Xiaoshu or Lesser Heat, 11th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 7th-22nd July
Dashu or Great Heat, 12th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 23rd July-6th August
Lidong or Start of Winter, 19th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 7th-21st November
Mangzhong or Grain in Beard, 9th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 6th-20th June
Winter Solstice, 22nd of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 22nd December-5th January
solar term
Bailu or White Dew, 15th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 8th-22nd September
Jingzhe or Insects Wake, 3rd of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 6th-20th March
Lixia or Start of Summer, 7th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 5th-20th May
the 24 solar terms, calculated from the position of the sun on the ecliptic, that divide the year into 24 equal periods
